items.title: Trump Administration Lays Off Dozens of C.D.C. Officials
items.summary: “Disease detectives,” high-ranking scientists, the entire Washington office and the staff of a weekly public health journal were among those who learned late Friday that they would lose their jobs.

items.title: Judge Signals She Is Likely to Order Abrego Garcia’s Release Soon
items.summary: The judge expressed frequent frustrations with the Trump administration, saying it had presented a “totally inconsistent” case to keep the Maryland man in immigration detention.

items.title: Bucksnort, Tenn., is a tight-knit community where neighbors help one another.
The Trump Split Screen: A Peacemaker Abroad, a Retribution Campaign at Home
items.summary: President Trump’s dueling personas were on display this week, providing endless ammunition to his allies and his enemies alike.

items.title: Boston Prosecutors Invoke Law Used Against Anarchists to Charge Protesters
items.summary: The charges are an indication that Boston’s mayor and Police Department are telegraphing to President Trump that they’re going to come down hard on civil unrest.

items.title: Here are some other factory explosions in American history.
After uproar, Pete Hegseth clarifies Qatari air force facility in Idaho is not a foreign base – as it happened
items.summary: <p>Earlier, Pentagon chief shared that location would host ‘contingent of Qatari F-15s and pilots’. This blog is now closed.</p><ul><li><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/10/federal-workers-pay-government-shutdown">White House announces federal worker layoffs as government shutdown nears third week</a></p></li></ul><p>As the shutdown enters its 10th day, and both chambers are out of session today, House speaker <strong>Mike Johnson</strong> has defended not passing a separate bill that would keep members of the military paid throughout the shutdown.</p><p>“Republicans have voted to OPEN the government and get our troops, Border Patrol, TSA, and veterans PAID,” Johnson said, before blaming Democratic leadership for refusing to pass the House-passed continuing resolution. “Chuck Schumer is terrified of a challenge from the Marxist left – so he and the Democrats voted to CLOSE the government-and to STOP PAYCHECKS from being issued.”</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/oct/10/letitia-james-donald-trump-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Trump completes ‘semiannual’ physical before traveling to Middle East
items.summary: <p>White House had described doctor visit as ‘routine yearly checkup’ although president had annual physical in April</p><p><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> – the oldest person ever to be elected US president – had what he has described as a “semiannual physical” at the Walter Reed national military medical center on Friday.</p><p>The visit, which the White House announced earlier this week, comes as Trump is preparing to travel to the Middle East on the heels of a ceasefire deal in the <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/israel-hamas-war">Israel-Hamas war</a>. The White House press secretary, Karoline Leavitt, described it as a “routine yearly checkup”, although the president had his annual physical in April.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/oct/10/trump-physical-walter-reed">Continue reading...</a>
